Name: Monopoly: DPR Construction 25th Anniversary Edition
Description:
In 25 short years, DPR Construction has grown into one of the nation's top technical builders with offices around the country building great things for some of the most progressive and admired companies in the world. In celebration of this milestone anniversary, the MONOPOLY brand is proud to present the MONOPOLY: DPR Construction 25th Anniversary Edition of the world's most famous board game! Increase work without competition on DPR projects while you build structures from site work to completion. Draw "Culture" and "Critical Success Factors" Cards along the way as you negotiate to dominate the market and won it all. Grab your favorite DPR-themed token and advance to GO!

Tokens include: Wine Bottle, Safety Cone, Key, Construction Hat, Boots and DPR Truck.

Name: Slam Words
Description:
Slam Words is the fastest word search game ever. Shake the cup, then slam it shut to lock in the dice and reveal three letters. Quickly find a word that uses these three letters, then pass the cup to the next player, who has to find a new word — or they are out.

Slam Words is part of FoxMind's "Slam Dice" portable game collection.

Name: Shogun No Katana Deluxe Edition
Description:
Feudal Japan, land of mystery, tradition, honor, and sharp steel. The katanas have always been fundamental for the outcome of the battles that have elected or overthrown the noble  and powerful families that dominate the different regions.

But behind these beautiful masterpieces, lies a millenary art made of technique and discipline. The smiths masters, keepers of ancient secrets, have the fate of entire families and the history of their country in their hands.

Shogun No Katana is a strategic Eurogame that will transport you to the magical atmosphere of feudal Japan.

Use your workers to choose which swords to make. Collect resources to improve your craft, and request your artists to create breathtaking decorations, and finally, create the most beautiful Shogun no Katana.

—description from the publisher

Name: Boundary T20 Cricket
Description:
Print and play cricket replay game which uses three dice and cards for the batsmen and a chart for everything else, principally bowler economy, how wickets fell, which fielder made any catches etc.

Batsmen are graded from 11 to 55 and the card for their grade is used to determine how many runs they score / whether there's a wicket possibility for each delivery (roll of the dice). It takes under an hour per innings if you record full batsmen/bowler details throughout.

Name: Star Realms: Rise of Empire – Infinite Replay Deck
Description:
This expansion set allows you to play Rise of Empire WITHOUT using stickers. It also enables you to reset your Rise of Empire campaign over and over and play through as many times as you like!

This expansion set includes a total of 180 cards.


     A fresh copy of the Rise of Empire 60-card Trade Deck. If you have played through Rise of Empire using the Sticker Sheets, you can set that original Trade Deck aside and replace it with this new one. 
     120 upgraded cards. This represents every possible ship and base upgrade that can be made in Rise of Empire! When you upgrade a card in the game, simply swap the non-upgraded card for the appropriate upgraded card from the Infinite Replay Kit.


Also included:


     A rules sheet with instructions for use with the Infinite Replay Kit. 
     A Trade Federation checklist indicating which upgrades are available in each game. 
     A Star Empire checklist indicating which upgrades are available in each game.

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #7
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #7 was published in April 1996.

Table of contents:
Harpoon scenario: Sea of Fire part 2
New WWW Harpoon page
Japanese Self-Defense Force Order of Battle
A matter of Form
There is something wrong with our ships...
Platforms Specifications: 
HMS Renown
German Bf 109E
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Trek 12: ArchéoTREK
Description:
Trek 12 ArchéoTREK is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in december 2021.

It consists in a new player board and some tokens to play especially with kids.

Name: Scum of Kilforth Promo Cards
Description:
Three promotional cards from 1815, Scum of the Earth: The Battle of Waterloo Card Game that expand Gloom of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game


     Forest: Cobman Buttons (stranger, noble)
     Item: Brown Bess (item, weapon)
     Plains: Torrential Rain (event)


Included in Gloom of Kilforth: Promo Pack 2

Name: Gloom of Kilforth: Promo Pack 2
Description: This pack consists of the three Scum of Kilforth Promo Cards (Encounter: Forest: Cobman Buttons; Item: Weapon: Brown Bess; Event: Plains: Torrential Rain) from 1815, Scum of the Earth: The Battle of Waterloo Card Game as well as the Gloom of Kilforth: Lifeform of Kilforth Promo Card (Encounter: Forest) from Lifeform, the Goodwife alternative art card (Encounter: Plains) and Vagabond (Ally) card for Gloom of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game.

Name: Tank Chess: UT & AO
Description:
Two additional tank types for Tank Chess: Ultra-heavy Tank and Armed Off-road vehicle.

The Ultra-heavy Tank (UT) is the strongest and the slowest vehicle. Its max speed is only 1 and its armor values are V, IV and III. On the front, it has a turrent with a double-barreled gun that shoots in three directions and has a value of V and in the back there is a smaller turret with another cannon (III) that shoots in three directions backwards. Like the Twin-gun Tank, the UT can also shoot at two targets simultaneously. On top of that, being a heavy means that it can destroy tree-type obstacles.

The Armed Off-road vehicle (AO) is the fastest piece in the game (max. 7 speed). The AO movement is different from the other pieces: it does not lose movement steps due to turning. Because of this, it can move even further, but at the same time it cannot rotate in place. Therefore, in each step this piece can move to a square that is right in front or to the squares that are left or right to that square.
When moving backwards, just like any other piece, Armed Off-road vehicle can only move once to the square that is right behind. But in this situation it may also turn at 45 degrees simultaneously (left or right).
The AO does not have any armour (0, 0, 0), and it has a recoilless gun that can shoot only right in front due to the mounting. The gun is weak(it has a value of I) and its range is limited to 5 squares (even though it can shoot over obstacles), which is another distinctive feature.

—description from the rules

Name: Tank Chess: Monster
Description: Additional Monster pieces for Tank Chess. It comes with its own rules.

Name: Dig it Up!: Crack the Crate
Description:
When the last of the dragons vanished, terrible Darkness spread across the land. Now the only hope the Kingdom of Valoria has is in an ancient prophecy that whispers of hidden orbs that hold the secret of ringing back the dragons and defeating the Darkness. Now it's up to you and your team to work together to save a precious dragon egg before the Darkness finds it. Crack the Crate and you will unlock the secrets of the dragons. Do you have what it takes to overcome the challenges, break the curse and discover a new breed of dragon that will save the kingdom?

This interactive, one-time-use game lets you merge the excitement of experiential escape rooms and Dig It Up! excavation projects into one exciting group activity! Work together with friends and family to save a precious baby dragon egg and keep darkness from spreading across the land. Do you have what it takes to overcome the series of challenges, unlock the secrets of the dragons and break the curse?

--description from publisher

Name: Ein lustiges Pilzesuchen
Description:
All 40 mushrooms are placed on any red dots on the game board.
The players take turns to roll and move. The goal of the game is to collect as much musrooms as possible. When all mushrooms have been collected, the colors on the bottom are revealed and the players get different points for each color. The player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Servit & Aureus
Description:
Aureus Fulgen from Dragonbond joins the race in Dodos Riding Dinos.

His Radiant Majesty allows you to exchange your hand of cards with another player if you are not in the lead.

Name: Biotopia: Truet!
Description:
BIOTOPIA "TRUET" ("Endangered") is a Danish expansion for BIOTOPIA.
This expansion adds 24 new cards to the game. 20 new butterfly cards that offers more strategic choises to the players, and seeks to bring the Compost Heap much more into play. Four new Mission Cards are also included for a much more varied game.

—description from the designer

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #8
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #8 was published in July 1996.

Table of contents:
Command at Sea Scenario: Derailing the Express
Supermarina Errata
PT boat rocket launchers
PT boat pecifications
Harpoon Scenario: Rough Riders
Platforms Specifications:
Thai CVH Chakri Narubet
Spanish VA.2 Matador II
Japanese Kagero-class DD
Japanese A6M2 Zero Fighter
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Maul
Description:
Maul is a competitive two-player card game with a fantasy theme, based on a tournament between two rival teams.  Each team is comprised of 10 players that have varied skills and attributes to suit their position/role.

Players battle through 6 rounds of full-contact action, with the team holding the Detonator at the end of each round gaining points. The team with the most points after 6 rounds wins.

The play area has 5 slots on each side that are available for players, and the location of the cards in relation to each other determine how they can interact. Turn-based actions such as passing, supporting, and hitting are taken, and can be backed up with Boost cards that have different effects on play or players!

—description from the publisher

Name: Apples to Apples Express: Marvel Edition
Description:
The Apples to Apples game ventures into the dazzling domain of the Marvel Universe with a wide array of Marvel Super Heroes and Villains!

As in the classic game, each player takes turns playing the judge. The round starts by the judge playing a Green Apple card. Everyone else plays a Red Apple card from their hand. These cards, with titles like “Black Widow, ” “Outrunning an Explosion, ” and “Hulking Out, ” are brought to life with dynamic Marvel comic book images! Amazing combinations are inevitable, but the judge decides the best match-up for each round.

Name: Marvel Boomez
Description:
Marvel Boomez is a collectible game with Chibi style miniatures for each character. These come individually in mystery booster packs or in preset boxes.
Each character miniature comes with a color coordinated 20 sided dice and a card which features his or her abilities.

The game itself consists of each player alternatively throwing a number of D20s defined by their character and trying to pass the defense threshold of the opponent character. When playing with several characters on each side, for each attack the player will choose which character will attack which opponent, while taking account of possible modifications caused by the special abilities in play.

Name: Bestride
Description:
This is a battle royale-style combat game where you move cards on your desk to fight.  Riders have range and weight.  Beasts have mobility and skills.  You unite them and fight, aiming to "survive to the end".

Obstacles, unpredictable erupting volcano, and ring cards scrambles that increase your chances of hitting make the game even more exciting.

Name: Above the Clouds!: Red Stars
Description:
Red Stars is an Aircraft Pack expansion for the "Above the Clouds!"  air-combat miniature wargame rules.  Red Stars provides the Russian aircraft performance displays (APDs) required for the encounters of the Russo-German Air War during 1942-1945, as well as some new German APDs for aircraft which were used nearly exclusively on the Russian front.

Red Stars includes the following 20 APDs:
Soviet: Il-2, Il-2 Type 3M,Il-2M, Il-4 (aka DB-3F), Il-10, LaGG-3, La-5, La-5FN, La-7, MiG-1, MiG-3, P-39 Kobra, Pe-2, Yak-1, Yak-3, Yak-9, Yak-9U

German: Fw-189, Hs-129, Ju-87G

Name: U-Boot-Krieg
Description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 50 to sink the "Warsprite" wins the game.

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #9
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #9 was published in October 1996.

Table of contents:
New Russian SSBN Class
Command at Sea Scenario: Looking for Trouble
Egyptian Romeo Update
Harpoon IV Rules Summary
If you have an earlier edition of Harpoon...
Command at Sea Corrections: Air Attack Tables
Platforms Specifications:
Australian FF HMAS ANzac
Taiwanese Ching-Kuo Fighter
British Carrier HMS Indomitable
British Skua Dive Bomber
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Armoured Storm: The Desert War 1941-1942
Description:
Armoured Storm: The Desert War is a quick-playing, simple-to-learn game of tank-versus-tank combat in World War Two. The rules are intended for battles between 15 and 30 tanks per side, plus 4 or 5 HQ tanks. This means, in game terms, that each player will command one or more companies of tanks organized into several platoons.

In Armoured Storm, you take the role of a commander first and a gunner/driver second. Your ability to give the right orders at the right time and bring your available firepower to bear more efficiently than your opponent, are more important at the level of command you’re representing. Out-thinking your opponent by being clear about your goals and through clever use of the Tactics Chart will bring you success.
Armoured Storm is in part inspired by the historical armoured battles of the Desert War – there are some excellent first-hand accounts of this – but also by the gung-ho action encountered in British and American comics.

THE ‘YOU COMMAND’ SERIES
‘You Command’ is a series of light wargames by Daniel Mersey. When you play a ‘You Command’ game, your goal is to defeat your opponent by out-thinking them tactically using the innovative Tactics Chart, and then by out-fighting their model army on the tabletop battlefield.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Unluckables
Description:
OVERVIEW:
Unluckables are a mad scientist’s experiment gone wrong. Created to give bad luck, they instead absorb it! But, if an Unluckable absorbs too much, they turn from playful candy loving creatures into trick playing pranksters.

Adopt Unluckables, play tricks, activate unique abilities and do your best to avoid the perils of Unluck.

The first player to end a round with 13+ Skellies, wins!

(additional win conditions included for increased challenge and excitement)

SETUP:
Each player will choose a uniquely colored Home card, which always produces 1 Skellie, and set it face up on the table in front of them. This table space will now be referred to as your “Home.” All adopted Unluckable, as well as certain Luck or Unluck cards with the “Hold” symbol, will be played into your Home.

Congratulations! If you are the first person at the table to read these instructions, you are now designated as the First Player. Deal 3 Luck cards face down to each player. They may look at their cards, but must keep them secret from all other players. After the first player ends their turn, play will continue clockwise around the table until all players have performed their actions. At the start of each new round the First Player will rotate clockwise.

STARTING THE GAME:
Starting with the First Player, you have 3 actions to perform each round. Available actions are:

Draw: Draw the top card of the Luck deck and add it to your hand.

Play: Play a Item, Trick or Support card from your hand.

Adopt: If you are able to meet the Skellie cost of an Unluckable indicated in the star symbol on the top left of the card, place it into your Home. You must draw and resolve Unluck cards up to the number indicated in the bat symbol on the top right corner.

Release: Discard any number of Unluckables and reduce the cost of adopting by their Skellie value until the end of your current turn. (adopting will require performing another action)

Activate: Perform the ability of an adopted Unluckable with an Activation  symbol. You may only use an adopted Unluckable’s ability once per round.

Trade: Trade any number of cards with another player. An action is only performed if another player accepts the trade, allowing you to make multiple offers without risk of losing actions.

After you’ve performed all of your available actions, the next player may begin theirs.

HAND SIZE:
Each player starts with a hand size of 5 cards, however there are ways within the game to increase your hand size. Players with more cards than their hand size must discard down, but only at the end of a round. This allows players to hold cards higher than their hand size for a brief, and hopefully beneficial, period of time.

WIN CONDITION:
When adopted Unluckables are providing any player(s) with 13 or more Skellies at the end of a round, the player with the most wins!

ALTERNATE WIN CONDITIONS:
Adopt 8 Unluckables in consecutive order of cost (1-8, 2-9 or 3-10) or attach all 6 unique items to adopted Unluckables for an instant win!

Play each win condition independently, or all at once.

-description from designer

Name: Dragonath
Description:
Dragonath is an asymmetric strategy wargame for 2 players in which you will control a civilization with their own  abilities and outplay your opponent in search of your Dragon’s Favor.
  
The multiple ways of gaining and losing Favor ensures each match is always unique. Customize your Reserve of Legions and Settlements and summon the Legends: powerful characters with  a Mission that provides an additional way to gain favor points.

Conquer the randomly generated map and boost your strategy with economic and military feats.

When playing Dragonath you will enjoy a challenging and dynamic wargame set in a vibrant fantasy world.

—description from the designer

Name: Helorian Battles
Description:
Helorian Battles is a points based deck construction card game where two-players battle for territory in Heloria!

Points based deck construction is the very core of this game. Two players agree on a maximum point total before playing, and they both construct decks not to exceed this point total.

Every card in the game takes one action to play. This means players can play their most powerful card on turn one if drawn. Each player gets 3 actions & 3 attack actions each turn to play cards and attack opponents.

Players may also expand to additional locations for more health, creating a dynamic battlefield of multiple locations to attack end defend.

The first player to reduce their opponent to zero health at the end of their turn wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Stollis
Description:
Stollis is an abstract tile laying & pattern recognition game in which 2-6 players try to align their polyomino shaped pieces with pieces that have been previously played to gain points. Players should pay attention to what pieces your opponents will play on their turn, so they don't set their opponents up for more points.

—description from the designer

Name: Rage'n Glyphs
Description:
Rage'n GlyphsRage'n Glyphs is a trick-taking descendant of Oh, Hell! and a cousin of Rage designed for the Glyph deck.

Bid on tricks you will take in ever-increasing hand sizes as the Trump suit changes or disappears!

				
				
					Summary of PlayEach player will be dealt a number of cards for each Hand, starting with 1 card and increasing by 1 every Hand.  Each player bids the number of Tricks he thinks he will win this Hand. Each player in turn then lays down a single card into each Trick.  The player who played the highest ranking card of the led suit (or the Trump suit) wins the Trick and takes the cards.  After each Hand, points are given for Tricks won, with bonus points given for correctly predicting the number of Tricks won.  The game ends after the maximum Hand size is reached, and the player with the highest score wins the game!

________________________________________________

				
				
					DefinitionsTrick = The cards on the table after each player has played a card.

Trump = The trump suit card determines which suit Trump is.  Trump cards win Tricks over cards of other suits.

Follow Suit = Players must, if able, play a card that has the same suit as the first played card of the Trick.
________________________________________________

				
				
					Rules of Play1) Setup 
A player is chosen as scorekeeper and writes the names of the players on the score sheet.  He then shuffles the cards and deals 1 to each player, this is the first Hand.  After each Hand, the player on the dealer's left becomes the new dealer.  The stack of undealt cards are placed face down on the table, and the top card is flipped over and placed next to the pile.  This is the Trump suit card, it determines the starting Trump suit for the current Hand.  If a joker is turned over, continue turning over cards until a suited card is revealed.  (In the extremely rare event all the undealt cards are jokers, hearts is the starting Trump suit.)

2) The Hands  
In the first Hand, each player is dealt 1 card, giving 1 Trick available to win the first Hand.  When a Hand is over, the cards are reshuffled and dealt, with each subsequent Hand increasing by 1 card.  So, in the second Hand, each player is dealt 2 cards, giving 2 Tricks available.  In the third Hand, each player is dealt 3 cards, giving 3 Tricks available.  The maximum number of cards that can be dealt evenly to the players (while leaving at least 4 undealt for the Trump suit pile) will be the final Hand.

For example: With 9 players, the final Hand will have 10 cards apiece.  There will also be 8 cards undealt, in a face down pile, to determine Trump.

3) Bidding
After the players have sorted their cards by suit and rank, each player considers how many Tricks he will win this Hand.  Beginning with the player to the left of the dealer and continuing clockwise, each player states their bid prediction for the Hand.  The scorekeeper notes the bids on the score sheet.

4) The Tricks
The player to the left of the dealer plays the first card in a Hand.  Play continues clockwise, everyone playing a single card into the center of the table.  If the led card has a suit, everyone must Follow Suit, if they can.  If the first card (or cards) played is a joker, the first suited card played sets the suit and all remaining players must Follow Suit.
If a player does not have a card of the suit led, he may play anything he likes, including a Trump card, or a joker.

5) Jokers
When jokers are played, they modify the trump suit.  Jokers cannot win a Trick, unless there is nothing but jokers in the Trick; in that case, the first played joker wins the Trick.  There are two types of jokers—four with 2 dots and four with 4 dots.

When a joker with 2 dots is played, the trump suit changes immediately.  Flip over the top undealt card until a different suit is revealed; this is the new trump suit.  (In the unlikely event that there is not a different suit in the undealt card pile, or if the whole pile is flipped over, the trump suit changes to the next lower suit, ranked mushrooms, hearts, diamonds, clovers, crosses, horns.)  This trump suit remains until the end of the Hand, or another joker is played.

When a joker with 4 dots is played, there is no trump suit immediately.  Flip over the trump suit card so they are all facedown.  Only the lead suit can win a trick.  There will be no trump suit until the end of the Hand, or a 2-dot joker is played.

6) Winning the Trick
The player who played the highest card in the suit which led the Trick, will win the Trick, unless a card in the Trump suit is played.  If a Trump card is played, it will win the trick.  If several Trump cards are in the Trick, the highest ranking Trump card wins the Trick.

Each Trick won by a player should be placed in separate piles, so it is always known how many Tricks each player has won to this point.

The winner of a Trick opens the next Trick by playing a new card from their Hand.  When each player has no more cards in their Hand, the Hand is over and points are scored.

7) Scoring 
After a Hand is over, each player receives 1 point for each trick they won.  They also receive 10 points if they correctly predicted the number of tricks they won, unless they bid 0.  If they bid and won 0 tricks, they only receive 5 points.  The total number of points is recorded on the score sheet.

				
				
					Game EndThe game ends after the largest Hand possible for that many players, leaving at least 4 cards undealt for the Trump suit pile.  So, for 10 players, there will be 9 Hands—with the final Hand having 9 cards.  9 players, 10 Hands.  8 players, 11 Hands.  7 players, 13 Hands.  6 players, 15 Hands.  5 players, 18 Hands.  4 players, 23 Hands.  3 players, 32 Hands.  (With smaller number of players, you may want to use the Skip Up variant below.)

After the final Hand is played and scored, the scores for all 10 Hands are added up.  The player with the highest score is the winner!

If there is a tie, the player who scored the most points the final Hand wins.  Still tied?  Flip a coin for the winner!

				
				
					VariantsSkip Up: For a shorter game, add 2 cards to each Hand.  So, the first Hand will have 1 card, but the second will have 3 cards, the third Hand will have 5 cards, and so on.  This is especially useful when playing with 5 or fewer players.

Hose the Dealer: The total number of bids may not equal the total number of Tricks available.  For example, in the fifth Hand, with 5 Tricks available, the total number of bids by all players may not equal 5.

Hidden Bid: Every player records their bid on a piece of paper.  When everyone has finished bidding, bids are announced and recorded by the scorekeeper.  This keeps the bids unaffected by competitor's bids.

Secret Bids: Every player records their bid on a piece of paper.  The bids are only revealed after the last Trick of the Hand is taken.  Therefore, it is unclear during the Hand how many Tricks each player would like to win.

Shooting the Stars: If a player wins all the Tricks in a Hand, he receives 2 points for each Trick taken, instead of only 1.  This includes the first Hand, with only 1 Trick available!

Name: Splatter
Description:
Splatter! is a trick taking card game based off of the theme of the ever-classic amphibious arcade game. But the twist is that instead of playing the frog, you are the car. For that matter, all players are cars-competing to splat that blasted frog!

Players play tricks, earning and building up their stock pile of ammunition and weapons to better help them splat that frog once and for all. Of course the frog, Splatter, comes with 6 lives so he can handle quite a bit. Players earn victory points by winning the trick when they are in position to do so (by being next to the frog when they win a trick). If a player wins a trick and is next to the frog, they eliminated one of the frog's lives and earns a pink wedge victory point.

The game is over after 10 rounds or when the frog is out of lives, whichever comes first. Whoever has the most 'froggy bits' (pink wedge pieces) wins the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Mystery Island Pirates
Description:
AHOY, ME HEARTIES! Yer setting off on a dangerous but rewarding adventure — navigate the perilous Mystery Islands in a race to win the treasure! The Pirates' Code of Conduct, ye ask? There is none! Savvy? Now batten down the hatches and anchors aweigh, mateys! MAY THE WORST PIRATE WIN!

—description from the publisher

Name: Kids Scavenger Hunt
Description:
In Kids Scavenger Hunt everyone has a rip-roaring good time as players frantically search for the objects pictured on their cards!!!

Whether you are stuck inside on a rainy day — or at the park on a beautiful sunny day — this game is a fantastic way to get kids moving. Kids Scavenger Hunt is year round fun for the whole family.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Hello Kitty: Picnic In The Park
Description:
Hello Kitty and her friends are looking for the perfect place to have a picnic. Choose Hello Kitty, FiFi, Jodie or Tracy, then take a card to find out what color space to move to next. Getting a Hello Kitty or a friend card can move you ahead. But a puddle card will always send you back.

Be the first player to get to finish to win!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Princess in the Making
Description: In this spin-to-move game players take on the role of one of four Disney Princesses â — Cinderella, Aurora, Belle, and Snow White â — starting at their associated start places on the board. To win a player must visit all four castles on the board with their princess standee, collecting a True Princess token at each, and then be the first to return to their associated castle. To collect a True Princess token the player must demonstrate a skill related to being a princess as described by that token. The skills described by the tokens are: balancing a cardboard book on their head, miming dancing with their prince, performing a curtsy, and complimenting another player.

Name: Um die Kopje
Description:
The playing consists of a square grid, on which two enemy commandos face each other. The one in A is the red command, the other in B is the blue command. In the middle is a kopje to fight for possession of. The winning command is the first to occupy the 5 squares framed with the color of the command. 9 figures of each color are required, which are placed on the spaces marked by colored discs. A move consists of either moving a piece one space, in any direction, or letting the piece make a single jump or a continuous jump. Only your own pieces can jump up to the squares of your color, where you have to pass between the enemy pieces, you naturally also jump over the opponent's pieces. If a command has succeeded in occupying one of the 5 squares of its color with one of its figures, the opponent loses a figure. Pieces that have already been placed on the squares of his color may not be removed. So it can only happen five times that one opponent takes pieces from the other, and that's the end of the game, because the command that only has 4 pieces left in the field can no longer occupy the kopje completely.

The game is set during the second Boer War (South African War 1899-1902).

—user summary

Name: Basilica
Description:
Basilica is an area control tile-laying game for two players set in medieval Florence offering heavy player interaction and easy-to-learn rules.

In this game, players take on the roles of competing architects overseeing the construction of a magnificent cathedral. Each turn, they place tiles to enlarge the cathedral and create areas of a single color while placing builder pawns to gain advantages and control areas. In addition, players execute orders to move or remove builders, increase abilities, block spaces, or tear down previously built cathedral parts. There are four tile colors in the game. Players' goals are to create the largest possible areas representing a single color and to have more pawns in these areas than their opponent.

Basilica designed by Åukasz M. Pogoda was first published in 2010 and further developed by the expansion Festum Fatuorum in 2012. The new edition by Portal Games includes the base game with a revamped game board, premium custom-made wooden pawns depicting medieval characters, and the expansion, offering players a premium full game experience.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #10
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #10 was published in January 1997.

Table of contents:
Harpoon Scenario: ASW in the 90's
1997 convention schedule
Harpoon IV Correction Annex: M3 Sonar Range Bands

Platforms Specifications:
American SSN USS Seawolf
Swedish JAS 39 Gripen fighter
American Airship USS Macon
American F9C Sparrowhawk
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Clash of Deck N°6
Description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fifth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. In this stand-alone expansion, you can pay HP to summon cards, gain mana more easily and heal thanks to new powers.

Name: Clash of Deck N°7
Description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fifth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. In this stand-alone expansion, you will counter-attack, combine cards and inflict overkill damage to the tower, thanks to new powers.

Name: Cellulose: A Plant Cell Biology Game – Coconut Scenario
Description:
New Scenario for Cellulose that adds a push-your-luck scoring mechanism to building carbohydrates. Each player has a Coconut that they can fill with Carbohydrates as they build them. At the beginning of each round, players score points for Carbohydrates on their Coconuts and roll a dice. Any player with at least as many Carbs as the dice rolls must move 1 of their Carbs to the Cell Wall, then discard the rest.

Initially released with Dice Tower Kickstarter.

—description from the designer

Name: Godtear: Kailinn, The Fury of the Forest
Description:
"Kailinn changed when she was Chosen. Imbued with the wild rage of nature, the fierce champion bears little resemblance to the demure acolyte she once was. A pair of Virtues follow her - druid warriors of her order, charged with protecting their tragic sister on her path to godhood."

Fast, furious, and fantastic at assassinating enemy followers before they can flee, Kailinn is a Maelstrom champion with a maelstrom attitude. No champion can match her speed as she canters across the battlefield with reckless abandon. Watch out for her wicked-sharp horn — it’s made for skewering followers of any size!

This expansion for Godtear adds 1 new maelstrom champion, along with its 2 large followers, 1 banner, and 3 cards with statistics and abilities.

Name: Doppelganger
Description:
Doppelganger is our hilarious new party game of comparing your friends and family to the famous and infamous.

Featuring 100 celebrities and famous faces (some good, some bad), your answers can either win or lose you points (and maybe win or lose you friends too, depending on whose name you write down).

Place the Doppelganger cards face down onto the table and flip one over. Using your answer cards, secretly write which player reminds you most of that person, for absolutely any reason (personality, looks, hair style, accent, name, eyebrows, fashion style, etc.) It really doesn't matter what the reason is, but you may be asked why). You can even vote for yourself!

Once everyone has secretly written their names, all answers are revealed (prepare to be offended)


     Win 1 point for choosing the player chosen by most others
     Lose 1 point for choosing a player nobody else has chosen
     Lose 2 points for if you’re the only player who chose yourself


First person to 12 points on the scorecard wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Zirkus Hoppla
Description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.

Name: Fest-Schießen
Description:
The small colored circles and the figures in the lower right and left corners are cut out; the former serve as game pieces, the latter as disc figures. Each player pays 10 tokens into the till. The players take turns to roll and move. Whoever hits a disc center first receives 2 tokens from the till, places the figure that shows this number on the upper edge of the disc and moves his token onto this number. Those who hit the center of a disc that is already occupied, remain there until the next throw and receive 1 token from the till as a consolation prize.
If a player gets to 48, he has to start over and loses the disc figures he already has placed, but not the tokens he received for them.
The last throw must show so many points that you just reach 70, otherwise the player returns from 70 as many squares as he rolled over 70. Whoever gets to 70 first gets 2/3 of the contents of the till, the rest goes to the person with the most disc figures.

Name: Dragon Slayer
Description:
A licensed board game adaptation of the PC-88 videogame by Falcom, Dragon Slayer.

The players move on a grid board to explore a dungeon and battle the dragon to keep their treasure.

Name: Guardians vs. Kaiju
Description:
In the future of 21xx, kaiju threaten the existence of humanity. Emerging from the earth, sea, and cosmos, these gargantuan monsters can only be stopped by Guardians, human piloted mechas and Earth’s last hope.

Guardians vs. Kaiju is a tactical tabletop micro-game that simulates battles between giant robots (mechas) and giant monsters (kaiju). One player takes on the role of a Guardian and one takes on the role of a kaiju as they customize their avatars and battle for supremacy.

With a piece of printer paper, a friend, and a handful of six sided dice, you can take part in gargantuan combat inspired by Into the Breach and Steve Jackson's OGRE.

Name: Peer-to-Peer
Description:
Peer-to-Peer is a team vs team semi-cooperative deck-building game using the Second generation (2021) Tech Deck, a 21st century deck of playing cards. Players divide into two teams and share a play deck and group hand. Each individual player has asymmetric abilities from their venture (Tech Deck cards) that can develop over time. Teams compete to assist customers from the Customer deck. Successfully assisted customers can be used to: 1. build up their team's deck, 2. develop individual ventures, or 3. score. Rules for odd-number of players and solo-play are included. The theme of the game is a 21st century modern setting. Players on a team cooperate together. Teams may choose to cooperate and negotiate and assist customers (semi-cooperative) leading to lively group discussion and dynamics. The game uses simple math and card melds to determine who successfully assists customers. There are three mutually-exclusive competing objectives: 1. to develop your team's deck, 2. to develop individual player's venture and 3. to score customers. Teams compete to assist customers and then the team must choose how to use that customer card towards these three objectives.

OBJECTIVE – Teams are trying to score points from assisting customers while building up their team’s deck and ventures.
GAME PLAY – During a turn, players can uses game effects from their hand cards and their ventures. Both teams try to assist customers in the customer row drawn from the customer deck. The game ends when there are no more cards left in the customer deck.

-description from designer

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #11
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #11 was published in April 1997.

Table of contents:
Command at Sea Scenario: Hell's Burma has Tigers!
UK joint RDF
The Phantom Destroyer
Night Battles: How to

Platforms Specifications:
Russian Krivak II FFG
Chinese Su-30 MK fighter
US Alaska CB
American P40-C Warhawk
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Calico:  Opposites Attract Tantrum House Promo Tiles
Description:
A new design goal where the opposite sides need to have the same pattern and/or color. Punchboard  includes 4 identical Design Goal tiles with a promo icon (star with a”T”) in the bottom center.

Originally available through the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter campaign in 2022.

Name: Cascadia: Ecosystem Connections Tantrum House Season 8 Promo Cards
Description:
Available during the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter campaign.

New promo card for the bear and hawk.

The bear will score if it is at least adjacent to one salmon and no any other bears.

The hawk scores for the direct lines of sight to both an elk and fox.

Name: Verdant: Multiple Choice Tantrum House Season 8 Promo Cards
Description:
Three new cards that can influence the scoring of plant/item/room goals, plus a Rules/Title card.

Originally available as part of the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter campaign in 2022. The promo cards have a dark green star icon with a “T” in the lower left corner.

COMPONENTS:
4 cards (56x87mm):

Plant Goals - One True Love: 1 point for each plant of a type of your choice.

Item Goals - Implement of Choice: 1 point for each token used of a type of your choice.

Room Goals - My Happy Place: double the points from a single room of your choice.

Rules/Title card.

Name: Escape from Ghost Castle
Description:
There is a chill in the air! Hide in a mysterious castle and avoid the ghosts that have decided to find you in their house. This ghostly adventure game for the whole family sends one player to hide in the castle, while the others play as the ghosts and try to find his or her hiding place. There will be no shortage of excitement, as both the hider as well as the seekers collect points until the very end! Who is victorious?

—description from the publisher

Name: Recollect: The Memory Challenge Game
Description:
Boost your brain power and improve your memory while having hours of fun with Recollect, the addictive memory challenge game by Pikkii.

Quick to learn and play, this brilliant family friendly game is great fun for both adults and kids.

Challenge your opponents’ memory, collect brain cells for correctly recalling the icons and gamble your brain cells to up the ante.

Packaged in a portable plastic-free box making it perfect for travelling, this addictive brain training game is both entertaining and brain boosting - what a great way to spend time with friends and family!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sokker
Description:
In this game, the players are football coaches trying to outsmart each other on the pitch. Just like in real life, the winner is the player who manages to score more goals than their opponent.

Players alternate taking turns and during their turn they may move one of their footballers. After that, if the ball is controlled by one of their footballers, player draws a card from the deck and resolves it. As a result of it the ball is being kicked and (if that footballer is in a correct position) a goal may be scored. The player who managed to score more goals than their opponent wins the game.

Name: CLUE: Critical Role
Description:
It’s time for the Harvest Close Festival in the city of Zadash, but a vengeful threat targeting one of the Mighty Nein is an unexpected wrench in the celebration! Take part in a side quest of epic proportions created in partnership with Critical Role with this role-playing twist on The Classic Mystery Game!

Is Isharnai targeting Nott the Brave in The Invulnerable Vagrant? Or does Captain Avantika have it out for Jester Lavorre in the Victory Pit? Solve the mystery before the festival ends to save one of your own from meeting their fate!

Help your favorite adventurers from Campaign 2 move between locations, gathering Rumour and Encounter cards to uncover:
WHICH hero token will reveal the member in danger, 
WHO is behind the spiteful plan, and 
WHERE they are planning to strike!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

Name: Il Concerto
Description:
A strategy and memory game in which the player must find all the instrument cards listed on their ensemble card during the same turn.

Before you start shuffle the 36 game cards in the middle of the table, in a grid.

Shuffle the ensemble cards and deal out 3 to each player. Each player chooses one.

Players take turns. 
The player turns over a card randomly chosen from the 36 on the table. If this is an instrument card shown on their ensemble card, they continue playing. 
The player then turns over another card and repeats the process until they have found all the instrument cards shown on their ensemble card.
When that happens, the player has completed the ensemble card and it is theirs to keep.

Shuffled, there are especial cards and jokers that can help you.

When the game has finished, the players add up the points on the completed ensemble cards.
The player with the most points is the winner.

Name: Fishing Lessons: Family Friends
Description:
Leland inspired everyone around him, even friends and neighbors. Though nobody seemed to learn the exact same lessons…

This 3-card expansion mixes up your memories by adding 2 new Lesson cards. These are shuffled in with the deck and then 2 random Lessons are removed, making your day on the lake less predictable. These Lessons also feature an option with a mandatory movement direction, giving you less control over your boat.

It also includes an additional double-sided Family card, adding two new characters with their own goals to complete.

Name: Fishing Lessons: Fabled Fish
Description:
Leland loved telling tall tales of the ones that got away. It’s time for you to prove that these lost legends are real!

This 4-card expansion adds a legendary fish. One of these cards will be added to the Lake at the start of the day. Whenever the fabled fish card is revealed, its unique ability will have a powerful impact on the game.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swarm Pack #1 – Hellbats
Description:
One of the most numerous and nightmarish of all the void creatures are the HellBats; swarms of slithering demons with leathery bat-like wings that darken the skies and bring ruin on worlds that they infest. HellBats are hatched from grotesque Spires of gnarled muscle built by a Brood Mother, housing countless mucus covered eggs. With a supernaturally fast gestation cycle, these Spires can hatch thousands of HellBats in a matter of days, and are only limited by having a steady supply of fresh flesh to feed upon. When that supply runs dry, the Spires simply go dormant until a new supply can be found, awakening the Spires once more.

An Enemy Swarm Pack is a new themed set of cards focusing on fighting swarms of a particular Enemy Type, as well as a new set of Spawners for that Enemy Type. In this case, the pack focuses on fighting large swarms of HellBats, and has Hatchling Spires that spawn new HellBats during a Fight.

This pack also includes Enemy Record Sheets for the OtherWorld variants of HellBats (BogBats, LavaBats, and LungBats), with the stats and modifiers worked into the Enemy Record Sheet itself, as well as new themed Elite Charts and Brutal sides for these variants.

A new Mission, HellBat Infestation, allows the Heroes to go on an adventure to clear out an infestation of these demonic creatures that is plaguing the area. This set assumes you have access to the HellBat Enemies (miniatures and cards) from the Swamps of Death Core Set, and does include an additional set of 6 HellBat miniatures, giving you a swarm of at least 12.

Hatchling Spires are a new Enemy introduced in this set, that act as Spawners for HellBats. Tall towers of ridged and gnarled demonic flesh, covered in large leathery eggs, the Hatchling Spires twist and sway as the creatures of the Void rapidly gestate inside before bursting forth. At the end of every Turn, each Hatchling Spire in play rolls 2 six-sided dice to Spawn new HellBats. This creates a new goal within the Fight for the Heroes to battle their way to the Hatchling Spires and take them out before you are overwhelmed by the flood of HellBats. This can be dangerous though as the Acidic Burst ability showers nearby Heroes with deadly acid every time a Spire takes damage from an Attack. In addition, the Spongy Sacks of the Hatchling Spire grant it +2 Defense against all Ranged Attacks made from half Range or greater of that Attack.

Contents:

     4 Large Enemy Record Sheet 
     3 Large plastic Hatchling Spire miniatures
     6 plastic HellBat miniatures
     1 Rule Sheet with new Mission – HellBat Infestation
     15 Game Cards

Name: Shibuya Night Out (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
Description:
In this expansion map for Age of Steam, the players take on the role of dispatchers for taxi companies in the Shibuya area, taking music lovers to the trendy clubs.  The colors of the cubes and clubs indicate the genre of music they prefer.

Each turn of the game, one genre of music will be the current trend, and delivering cubes of that color on that turn will earn a player extra income.

The map is hexless and does not use the urbanization action.

The designer also created a club playlist to listen to while playing the map.

Name: Ark Nova: Zoo Map Pack 1
Description: Ark Nova: Zoo Map Pack 1 contains the two new zoo maps #9 (Geographical Zoo) and #10 (Rescue Station).

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Challenge Pack #3 – Master of Blades
Description:
Of all the Lieutenants within the Fallen Shogun’s inner circle, the Takobake Blade Masters are perhaps the most terrifying. Towering mutant samurai wielding four razor sharp blades in their tentacled arms, the Blade Masters are not only expert swordsmen and strategists, but ruthless assassins, dispatched to carry out the most gruesome and sinister missions for their ambitious master.

Challenge Pack #3 – Master of Blades is themed for taking on a deadly Takobake Blade Master and the army of Takobake soldiers that he commands! This set includes a new deck of Enemy Trait cards called Army of the Takobake that can be assigned to all Takobake Enemies in a Fight, giving them new and powerful abilities and behaviors. These Trait cards are used as part of the included Mission, but can also be applied to Takobake Enemies in your normal games of Shadows of Brimstone, if you want to add extra challenge to a Fight, or to theme a Mission around battling savage beastly foes!

A Challenge Pack is a new themed set of cards with a terrifying new Enemy and a nightmarish new Mission designed to give the Heroes an extra challenge. These cards are all used together for the included Mission but can also be added to your card decks to increase the challenge across your normal games of Shadows of Brimstone as well. Many of these new cards are marked with a Challenge Icon, to be easily identified as extra dangerous.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Enemy Traits Pack #4 – Masters of the Void
Description:
Trait cards are used to give a particular enemy type more diversity (and often a bit more danger). This is the fourth in a series of Trait Packs that re-visit established enemies from Shadows of Brimstone, adding unique new traits to them, and making them feel different each time you encounter them! This Card Supplement contains a set of trait cards for each of the enemies from the Shadows of Brimstone: Masters of the Void Deluxe Enemy Pack: Void Sorcerers and Void Hounds. It also includes 5 new Void Magik Spells!

Contents:
10 Enemy Trait cards
5 Void Magik spell cards

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Cold of Space Game Supplement
Description:
It is time to re-enter the deadly Derelict Ship! This new set of cards intensifies the action and intrigue as your heroes feel the 'Cold of Space'.

This 15 card supplement adds a collection of all new Derelict Ship cards for Shadows of Brimstone: 5 new Derelict Ship Artifacts, 5 new Derelict Ship Encounters, and 5 new Darkness cards themed around the Derelict Ship.

Name: What The Actual Factual
Description:
Get ready for a fun and memorable night in with your friends and family with What the Actual Factual, our hilarious new party game where the fake answers win!

Super quick to learn, this brilliant game will put your bluffing and persuading skills to the test, while you use your detective skills to try and suss out which players have made up an answer and who has the actual fact.

Here's how to play:


     Read the first part of the fact card aloud (the second part of the fact remains hidden). Many of these facts will make you say WTAF!?
     All players receive an answer card - only one random player has the actual fact while everyone else has to think on their feet and make up a convincing fake fact.
     Everyone takes turns to read their “facts” aloud.
     Players place their voting tokens next to the person who they believe has the actual fact. This is the point where you need to convince people to move their tokens and vote for you.
     The actual fact is revealed. Players who voted for the correct answer win 1 point each. Players win 1 point for each vote their fake answer receives. First to 20 points wins the game.


What the Actual Factual - Can you come up with an answer that's more believable than the truth?

—description from the publisher

Name: Cutthroat Ninja: Defensive Booster Pack
Description:
Tired of having your Attacks, stolen, swapped and discarded? Or having your Poison Dart and Dragon Rages getting moved around in your Attack List?

Well no more! With this Booster Pack you simply shuffle these cards into your original Cutthroat Ninja deck and play!

No you can have the ability to:


     Block
     Reverse
     Hide in the Shadows
     Play a Secret Move
     Assign an armored guard to the Target
     Provide the Target with an Armor.


Make Cutthroat Ninja that more wild with this Defensive Booster Pack!

—description from publisher

Name: Photoghasts: The Haunted Photo Game
Description:
Dare you  take on the haunted terrors that reside within each Photoghast?
 Photoghast is a 42 card set with 30 Augmented Reality Photoghast character cards and 12 action cards.

The assigned dealer, shuffles and subsequently splits the pack by the set number of players (up to 4) laying the cards face down. The 30 Photoghast cards are split into the equal number of players playing. With each player also dealt a set number of ‘action cards.’  Then, the dealer launches the Photoghast app on their phone.

Once the game begins, each player takes turns in scanning their cards in the allocated time in the hope of exorcising or ‘fading’ each photo. Exorcise as many ghosts as possible. But beware, that camera shutter can stick, allowing more ghosts to be scanned by your opponent. Or even worse, you might scan the wrong card unleashing the ghost trapped inside.

Each card has its own point value system and every time one is scanned it’s very own custom animation will be triggered.

Oh and here’s the scary part. Play the game after 9pm and you run the risk of disturbing the original Photographer, which adds additional dangers. There's a 'safe' mode to allow you to play the game as usual after 9pm.

The game ends when the decks have been exhausted.  The player who has exorcised the most ghosts wins.

Name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #12-13
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #12-13 was a double number published in October 1997.

Table of contents:
Naval gunnery in the 20th century
Kashin Class Specifications
Errata for Harpoon IV
India's Godavari First-hand
Goodbye to the Intruder
Harpoon scenario: David and Goliath
New torpedo annexes for Harpoon IV
Japanses APDs of WWII
Expanded Command at Sea: Critical Hit Tables

Platforms Specifications:
German Fw200 Condor
German Bismarck BB
German Prinz Eugen CA
Soviet Sverdlov CL
British AStute SSN
Russian Il-28 Beagle
JApanese F-2 Fighter
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Wargamer's Guide to Afrika Korps
Description:
A 49-page supplemental booklet for the Avalon Hill wargame, Afrika Korps. Contains variant rules plus strategy and analysis articles. Recently reissued in PDF form with a new afterword by editor Don Greenwood.

User Summary

Name: Wargamer's Guide to Stalingrad
Description:
A 65-page supplemental booklet for the Avalon Hill wargame, Stalingrad. Contains variant rules plus strategy and analysis articles. Recently reissued in PDF form with an afterword by James Lowry.

User Summary

Name: Special Ops Issue #10
Description:
Special Ops #10 has ten articles, two ASL scenarios and two ASLSK scenarios,  The magazine also features the game Blitzkrieg to Moscow 2.

Featured articles cover Front Toward Enemy, Iron Curtain (with additional scenarios), Last Blitzkrieg, Panzers Last Stand, and more. There are also a ASL SK article and a couple ASL articles, including a preview of the upcoming HASL covering Marco Polo Bridge.

Blitzkrieg to Moscow 2, originally published by Bonsai Games, is a quick playing eastern front game. The game has one map, eight pages of rules, 12 cards, and 60 1" counters.
Families: Game: Advanced Squad Leader Starter Kit

Name: Turf War: Trick-or-Treat
Description:
The first major expansion for Turf War features a Halloween motif. Candy is a new resource that you can buy when you're Away, earning VP and building a stash. It's a challenge to hold onto your Candy though: You never know when a Trick-or-Treater is going to pop-up. When they do, you'll need to give them Candy and score points or else deal with the consequences of whatever trick they play on you.

The expansion adds 72 cards, including monstrous Neighbors, thematically spooky yard decor, Tools, and Pests, and a ton of new Events. The expansion accommodates 2-4 players.

—description from publisher

Name: Volcano Dice Game
Description:
For this dice game you will need 6 dice and three chips or tokens for each player. You don’t even need a paper and pen to keep score.

Lucky Charm
First, everyone picks a number to be their lucky charm. It is okay for more than one player to have the same lucky charm number. Once the number has been picked, it stays the same for the whole game. Next, the first player rolls all six dice trying to roll a 6. If he is successful, the dice with 6 on it is set to the side and play moves on to the next player. Instead of rolling a 6 a player can also use more than one dice to add up to the number. For example, if rolling for a six and no six was rolled but a 4 and a 2 were rolled they can be used to add up to six. In this case, both the 4 and 2 dice are set aside. Next, the player on the left rolls the remaining dice to try to roll a 5. Play keeps going in this fashion until 1 is reached. If 1 has been reached and rolled, then play starts over at 6 with the next player.

Missing the Mark
On the other hand, if a player does not roll the number that she is trying for and can not add any dice to make the number, she is in jeopardy. She is standing on the edge of the volcano, waiting to see if she will survive or be sacrificed. She has one turn to roll the same dice that she just rolled and try to get her lucky charm number. If she rolls her lucky charm, she is safe. Play starts over at six with all six dice with the next player. If she doesn’t roll her lucky charm then she is sacrificed and thrown into the volcano. She loses one of her chips. Play starts over with all six dice and then next player.

When a player loses all of his chips, then he is out of the game.
Play continues until all the players but one have run out of chips. This last player is safe. The Volcano Powers are satisfied with the sacrifices. This player is the winner.

Name: OLIGOQUOTY
Description:
The theme of this game is investment capitalism. Purchasing minor, major, or complete equity control in apartment housing regions and company sectors (i.e., airline services, legal and accounting services, and two different public services) will help a player win the game in multiple ways.

For example, a player with a designated sum of cash on hand and no loans or who owns two complete sets of equity control in an apartment housing region or company sector and no loans wins. Other winning methods involve parameters outlined in the ruleset and agreed on by players before the game starts (i.e., timed games or when players wish to stop playing).

First, players use a 12-Sided-Die to roll and move around spaces on the game board. Then they choose to buy or pass on investment opportunities. These choices affect their passive income (salary) and income from other players (penalties). Along the way, the owned investments grow, and players may collect additional revenue from drawn cards (one free set and one set that is not). Players may also collect cards that can get used in place of rolling the 12-Sided-Die.

Fear not the dilemma of non-trading players HODL'ing (holding on for dear life). A significant equity control (50%+) allows players to take over entire housing regions or company sectors by rolling the 12-Sided-Die higher than a competitor.

Please do not play it like Monopoly, or you may lose. So be the one who wins intelligently and earn the right to boast about your strategy (and luck).

—description from the designer

Name: Star Force 300
Description:
Star Force 300 is a 1/300 scale Science-Fiction miniatures wargame. 
Mid to large size battles of miniatures from the British company "QT Models". Combined Air/Land combat in the Grand Tactical scale. In Star Force 300 the forces of the Federation (Human) fight against the mighty legions of an Alien race known as the Ramorians.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Pioneers of Utopia
Description:
The stage is "Togenkyo"! !

Girls chosen as representatives from each country to develop Tougenkyo.
Refining the five elements consisting of wood, fire, earth, metal, and water through alchemy, developing bases to extract the power of the elements, training to handle the elements more effectively, and unlocking/awakening further power. and repeat actions such as traversing Taoyuan Township.
In order to save mankind and make their own dreams come true, the winner will be the one who masters alchemy the most.

Name: Scuttleball
Description:
Summer is here and that means one thing for you and your crab buddies: Scuttleball! Scuttleball is just like volleyball but for crabs! You’ll need skill, luck, and guts if you want to win this tricky little dice game.

Scuttleball is a 2-player dice-placement game that fits in a mint tin. Despite its small size, short rules, and bunch of dice, it offers a surprising amount of tense tactical moments and thematic tie-ins. At the beginning of each round, or volley, both players roll nine dice concealed behind their hands. Players alternate making a play on the ball by placing a die on their side of the court that exceeds the value of the last played die. The volley continues until one player can't make a play. Here's the exciting part: every space on the court has a special action that is activated when a die is placed. Actions are things like reroll a die, boost its value, or mirror an adjacent die. You’ll have to activate the right ability at the right time if you want to keep the volley going!

Scuttleball contains three different courts to accommodate different skill levels and game preferences: backyard (casual), beach (standard), or gymnasium (expert). There is also a free downloadable file to design your own court!

-description from designer

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Asgardians Affiliation Pack
Description:
The forces of Asgard unite in this squad pack for Marvel: Crisis Protocol!
Bringing together Thor, Valkyrie, Hela, and Loki, this pack is the perfect way for your players to quickly begin collecting the elite warriors of Asgard.

In addition to highly detailed miniatures, this pack also includes a stat cards for each of these characters updated with new graphic design as well as copies of the all the cards and tokens found in the CP11 - Thor & Valkyrie and CP12 - Loki & Hela packs, ensuring your players have everything they need to field these characters.

—description from the publisher

Name: Udexia
Description:
Udexia is a game/book made of 53 puzzles, tied together by a theme around magic and a handful of narrative drawings. Each puzzle leads to a word or a number that you can validate on a webpage. You then receive a "key" (a word, a number or sometimes an image). The webpage for a given puzzle can be easily accessed by scanning a QR code on the book, an efficient way to keep the gameplay experience mobile and casual.

While some puzzles require keys from previous puzzles, most are independent in the first part of the game - in order to avoid frustrating new players.

When you have figured out how to solve a puzzle, it only takes a handful of seconds or minutes to "execute" what needs to be done.

—description from the designer

Name: Moji Challenge: Fantasy
Description:
Moji Challenge: Fantasy involves 165 challenges (3 difficulty levels) across 55 cards to get all your parties going. Play in pairs or in teams, choosing from a huge range of game varieties. Become cold-hearted zombies, decadent vampires, wild werewolves and many more!

The rules are simple. Each challenge completed successfully wins you fame points. The first player or team to score 15 fame points wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monsters
Description:
Monsters is a 20 minute tactical cardgame for 2 mages who control ugly to fight each other. Main mechanism is card drawing and unique abilities.
Game is play in rounds. Every round you will play cards under your command to defeat opponent by reducing his healthpoints to 0.

Name: Moji Challenge: Classic
Description:
Moji Challenge involves 165 challenges (3 difficulty levels) across 55 cards to get all your parties going. Play in pairs or in teams, choosing from a huge range of game varieties.
The rules are simple. Each challenge completed successfully wins you fame points. The first player or team to score 15 fame points wins.

Classic deck cards will help your parties go off with a hilarious bang – you will become eMOJI masters capable of expressing all sorts of feelings and emotions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Crystal Age
Description:
Crystal Age is a fantasy board game for 1 to 4 players with an approximate duration of 30 minutes per player. It has three different game modes: solo, cooperative, and PVP.

The corruption of the crystal spreads through the world. Become a Hero and collaborate with your allies to defeat it or fight against the other heroes and become the Lord of Corruption.

In the past, a colossal crystal fell from the sky into the center of the land of Ansel, forming a huge crater. It began to corrupt the nearby biomes, and the creatures that lived there became more powerful and hostile. The kingdoms sealed the crater with 4 magical guardians, and surrounded it with a giant wall to prevent the spread of this strange disease, called corruption.

You are a Hero graced with power from heaven and you feel the call of the crater....

Now tell me... Will you use your power to help end the corruption? Or will you submit to the greed and doom of being the most powerful hero of Ansel?

Welcome to Crystal Age!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hierarchia
Description:
Hierarchia is a card game. Look at the beautifully illustrated characters, learn about the church hierarchy, think logically and have fun.

Gra karciana "Hierarchia" to ciekawa propozycja dla tych, którzy lubiÄ… spÄ™dzaÄ‡ czas w gronie najbliÅ¼szych, znajomych i przyjacióÅ‚. Przyjrzyj siÄ™ piÄ™knie zilustrowanym postaciom, poznaj hierarchiÄ™ koÅ›cielnÄ…, logicznie myÅ›l i dobrze siÄ™ przy tym baw.

Name: Prusage
Description:
Turn based strategic game including deck building. Every deck has 25 unique cards which can decide the fate of the game.

Turowa gra strategiczna na zasadzie budowania swojej unikalnej armii. Podstawowa 1 talia posiada 25 rÄ™cznie rysowanych kart z niepowtarzalnymi mocami które mogÄ… zmieniÄ‡ losy rozgrywki. W podstawce znajdziemy 3 rasy Ludzi, Elfy, Umarli.

Name: Doctor Who: Solitaire Story Game (Third Edition)
Description:
A FREE print and play solitaire paragraph-booklet adventure game where the player assumes the role of the intrepid Time Lord himself - the Doctor!

This web-published game is played using four booklets: Rules, Adventures, Enemies, and TARDIS Manual. Two six-sided dice are also required. All the Booklets, plus all support materials are in the Files section below. Players may either play as a Doctor from the TV show (with 9-12 included in the Core Set) or create their own incarnation.

DWSSG3e is a storytelling game with plenty of events and situations, so each game will be a new, fresh experience.
An Adventure begins when the TARDIS lands at a location, be it modern-day London, the wilds of Sherwood Forest, or the distant planet of the Ood Sphere. An Adventure is played out as a series of Turns where you choose Actions, such as Exploring or Investigating.

After each Action, you may encounter an Enemy and consult the Enemy Booklet. In an Adventure, you need to Defeat an Enemy that begins as unknown but by taking Actions and gaining Knowledge to find out what has been happening, you will reveal the Enemy. However, the Enemy is never idle and always getting closer to completing their plans. You will have to track the current Danger in the Adventure and you will lose an Adventure if the Danger total is ever 20 or more.

Defeating an Enemy will gain you Victory Points, which is the way you can win the game. Once you finish an Adventure, you return to the TARDIS Manual and journey onwards into Time and Space.

—description from the designer

Name: The Rent
Description:
An autobiographical game about the real face of poverty.

Playing solo, you need to balance your physical, emotional, social and financial wellbeing while making the rent each month.

This game asks players what they need to sacrifice in order to pay their rent. The difficult decisions that come with the cost of living versus living a good life. Will you be able to have savings? Maintain relationships? Afford basic necessities? A serious game about what it means to survive.

TRIGGER WARNING: 
This game is designed to simulate life in poverty or near-poverty, and how much we sacrifice just to get by.

Even if you win, you will lose a lot. If you or someone you love has experienced this cycle, the game may be extremely emotional for you to play.

Take steps to ensure you have self-care available before and after you play.

—description from the publisher

Name: I Still Dream of My Father
Description: I Still Dream of My Father is a single-player, card-based RPG in which you play through the experiences of someone trying to come to terms with the aftermath of a Very Damned Difficult relationship with their father. Choose your own path as you immerse yourself in your characters life, where sometimes it’s hard to tell what’s inside and what’s outside your mind, as you wend your way toward the ultimate moment of contemplation, where you must decide how you want to move forward and what it means about who you are.

Name: Ave, Leo!
Description:
A quick family-friendly game for 2-6 players, where gladiators compete with each other (and a hungry lion) for gold and glory.

Players take turns to draw from a common pool of dice to move their meeple, or the lion (an obstacle), or to distribute gold coins over the game arena.

Getting first to 7 coins collected crowns you the winner.

Name: Ginormopod 2050 A.D.: Attack of the Giant Bug Monsters
Description:
GASP! at a startling vision of the world yet to come!

CHEER! for the brave people of tomorrow fighting a desperate struggle for survival!

SCREAM! at uncanny creatures too horrifying to describe, the children of the nuclear age who now wish to claim our dying planet as their unholy birthright!

As waters and temperatures rise, and coastlines sink, gigantic insects sweep across the western United States. The only thing holding them back is the Fusion Fence built along the mighty Mississippi. But will it buy us enough time to complete work on the anti-mutagen – humanity's last hope?

Ginormopod 2050 A.D.: Attack of the Giant Bug Monsters is a retro-futuristic treat, presenting a 2050 as it might have been imagined by Hollywood a hundred years earlier. The proven design team of Ryan Heilman and Dave Shaw (Brave Little Belgium, White Eagle Defiant) has returned with another action-packed game. One player controls American forces and their allies, choosing carefully where to defend, when to fall back, and how to counterattack. Their resources are limited, and every decision has a cost. Their opponent controls the Swarm, throwing an endlessly respawning supply of mutated ants, spiders, and worms, brought to life by the delightful illustrations of Wil Alambre.

—description from the publisher

Name: Koala Kraze
Description:
Use the powers of your koalas to get rid of your cards first to win! Invented by Sofia and Luca, two siblings under 10 who mostly get along.

Get everyone to the table! Koala Kraze is for 2-8 players ages 6 and up, and you'll learn to play in 2 minutes. The game's 100 cards fit in a small box, so you can take it with you anywhere you go!

We commissioned some amazing hand-painted koalas just for this game, and their personalities burst through the cards!

Ready for Extreme mode? Start with the Junior mode to keep it simpler for younger kids, or try Extreme mode for older kids and adults!

Koala Kraze is a family-friendly game where the goal is to use your Koala Friends to discard all your cards first. If you've played Uno, Crazy Eights, or any other card-shedding game, you already know how to play!

Shuffle the deck, deal some cards out, and you're ready to play! Each turn, you'll play a Number card or a Koala card. Number cards can be played if they're one above or one below the Number card on the discard pile. If a Koala card's on top, play any number card you like! Each Koala card has a special power to help you play or discard more cards. Use the Burglar to switch hands with another player, or play the Big Boss to make a player discard a Koala card.

You can play two modes with the same cards. The simpler 'Junior' version is all about getting rid of your cards first, which is great for younger kids. A game like this is great for teaching colors and numbers, or for recognizing colors and numbers as the game gets fast!

If playing with older kids or adults, the 'Extreme' version adds a bit more challenge while keeping the core gameplay the same. As you play, pay attention to the scoring icons which say 'plus' or 'minus'. Sometimes the card you want to play will cost you points, so be careful! Some Koalas (like the Disk Jockey) will help discard those cards so they won't hurt your score, and a waypoint system ensures you can't go below certain milestones once you've achieved them.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pyramiden-Bau
Description: The game board consists of four pyramids broken down into individual small pyramids. At the beginning of the game, each player makes a throw and places his piece on the small square of one of the four pyramids that has the same number. This space, occupied at the beginning, forms the foundation stone of the pyramid to be built by the player and the number indicated on it shows the "base number". The player who rolled the base number 1 is king or queen and begins. There can be multiple kings in the first game. However, if no 1 is thrown, the next lower number begins. Corresponding to the rolling, the game piece is then placed as many spaces further sideways as eyes have been thrown. When the end of a row is reached, the player moves on to the next higher row until he reaches the top of the pyramid. If a player throws his basic number, he is not allowed to move, but rather has to wait until it is his turn again. If the player rolls more points than he needs to fill the capstone, he must move back from the top of the pyramid by as many squares as he has rolled points too many. This is repeated until he manages to get to the keystone. The king or queen make an exception to this. These may occupy the capstone immediately as soon as they reach it or have rolled beyond it. Whoever is the first to finish building his pyramid receives the first prize and becomes king for the next game with the basic number 1. Whoever throws the basic number 1 in the next game must exchange it for 2, since the king number is then only one player may own. If several players finish in a round, the one who threw the lowest cornerstone at the beginning of the game has priority, i. h. started building the pyramid with 1 or the next lowest square.

Name: Joking Hazard: Deck Enhancement #4
Description: Mix these 100 cards in with your Joking Hazard game for a bigger, girthier deck. Size matters, enhance your deck.

Name: Galactic Jaxx
Description:
The classic game of jacks has been reinvented for a new space and time. This is Galactic Jaxx! Work to fill up the empty star spaces on your constellation cards to earn points and abilities. Spin the Drop Zone Spinner for an added challenge to your grab. Bounce the ball and try to grab the correct number of Jaxx.

Each turn players try to complete their Constellation Cards by collecting and placing the correct colors of Jaxx onto their cards.
