In order to collect Jaxx players have to bounce the Space Ball and grab Jaxx before the ball hits the table a second time. A player's Star Gear will tell them how many Jaxx they need to collect in a turn. Take too many or too few Jaxx and your turn is unsuccessful; drop all of those Jaxx back into the center. The more a player succeeds the higher their Star Gear Tracker will go, but one wrong move and their Star Gear goes back to the start.

Every successfully grabbed Jaxx a player gets goes onto their Constellation Card. Each constellation card requires a certain number and set of colors to complete. Once all those requirements are met, that player scores their card and gets a new Constellation. The first player to get 15 or more points, WINS!

–description from designer

Name: World of Draghan: O Dodo!
Description:
Once upon a time dodos were living carefree in the realm of Draghan. Especially the little dragons saw the funny birds as cuties, but everything changed when the Dutchmen arrived. With their ships they brought many animals that neither the dragons nor the dodos had set their eyes on before: rats, dogs, pigs... All these creatures hunted the dodos and ransacked their eggs. Unworldly and peaceful in mind, the dodos hadn’t been able to stand their ground against these reckless invaders. Can you help the dodos to hatch as many eggs as possible and save them from extinction?

'O Dodo!' is a push your luck game in which you must constantly choose between low risk and high reward. During your turn you alternate in playing a card from your hand and a blind card from the draw pile. You add the cards to one of the nests and the value of the cards you play must go higher and higher. Make the nests as big as you can, so you can hatch as many eggs as possible at the end of your turn. But also know when to stop. When the card you draw from the draw pile is too low or when your hand is empty and you can't hatch the eggs in one of the nests your turn is over and you’ll see another player profit of your hard work.

Thanks to the many included variants, the dodos continue to surprise and challenge you even after a long time. A few of the included variants:
- Add ruse cards that will activate a special effect.
- Gather the loot so you can return cards from the discard pile to your hand.
- Add effects to the nests that you can use once during your turn to activate a special effect.
- ...

The game also includes a solo variant and a solo campaign where you have to earn enough points each game to buy a ruse card that you can use from the next game on. The more ruse cards you buy the more chances you have to increase your score. Try to unlock them all and go for the magical score of 100 points to save the dodos from extinction!

-description from publisher

This game is part of the 'World of Draghan'-series.
Part 1: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/284585/world-draghan-once-upon-dragon
Part 2: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/285208/world-draghan-sneaky-ol-dragons

Name: Sewerville Shootout
Description:
A Laserburn scenario featuring 3 map cards, an 8 page umpire folio and a 4 page player folio.

Or to boldly go where no man has gone before.

This scenario is set in an old complex of sewers, code-named "Sewerville". The ends of the main access tunnels collapsed ages ago, sealing this area off. No attempt was made to rescue the workers and robots that were trapped, and it was not long before they were forgotten.

Recently though, it was discovered that the "Android Liberation Front" has its headquartesr down there. The Imperial inquisition has succeeded in getting one of their agents accepted by the ALFists, but the only information he has been able to sneak out is that they are camped in the lower level of the system, and that a large scale attack will soon be launched by them.

Rather than risk their agent being discovered by the Frontists by bringing in Inquisition agents from all over the city, they have decide to risk the lives of an expendable group of mercenaries. Of course, the question of payment rears its ugly head, and rather than chop it off (the usual Inquisition tactic), the mecenaries will be paid.

- from the players manual

Name: K.O. Corral: The Game of Aim and Fame
Description:
The K.O. Corral has been overrun by legendary outlaws! As one of the frontier’s best bounty hunters its up to you to stop them. Be the first player to collect all the gold, gain all the fame and ride your trusty horse off into the sunset to win! Roll dice to gain bullets and populate the town with outlaws. Flick bullet dice at outlaws to try and knock them over and gain their rewards. As you ride off into the sunset, the dice launcher gets further back making your shots harder.

In K.O. Corral each player takes the role of one of the 4 Bounty Hunters. During each turn players will roll the black Outlaw dice, and choose which dice to keep and which to preroll. Outlaw dice can send outlaws or enemy bounty hunters into town, and give players ammo to fire at targets in the town. Once loaded up on ammo, players will take Gold Bullet Dice, place them into the dice launcher and flick them at the stand-up targets in town. Fire away! Successfully knocked down Outlaws will give that player rewards in gold and fame. Knock down an opponent, and you can steal some of their gold.

The first player to hit 10 gold, 10 fame, and move their trusty horse into the 10 space, wins the game!

–description from publisher

Name: HeroQuest: Hero Collection – The Rogue Heir of Elethorn
Description:
Prepare for battle! Independent, but loyal to the monarch, The Rogue Heir of Elethorn is a nimble skirmisher deadly with small blades. When you play as this hero, you lack the ability to use metal armor and shields, but you're equipped with your trusty bandolier, and are always ready to meet danger head on

This collector's edition item includes 2 highly-detailed Rogue Heir of Elethorn figures with powers and skills not seen in other HeroQuest characters.

It also includes 12 game cards, and a story card featuring an important letter from a secret group addressed to the Rogue Heir.

Contents: 2 finely detailed miniatures, 12 game cards, and story card.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Rogue Mana
Description:
In this turn-base strategy game, you and up to three Mage companions savvy in an elemental form of magic work together to ascent the Tower of Rogue Mana. Mages will battle devious enemies and tower chaos magic to find treasures and new spells. As a collective, the Mages work to ascend the Tower and receive the highest marks of wizardry!

Rogue Mana is a classic dungeon-crawler, great for newbies and veteran gamers alike. The growth of power format allows Rogue Mana to be played as a campaign over seven sessions. During each session, the Mages enter a new floor of the Tower that they must conquer until they defeat the 7th and final floor to receive their marks. There are 14 levels for variation and deployability.

During each turn, players collect Mana Crystals which are used to cast spells in your hand. These spells may harm an enemy, allow you to assist a fellow player in need, or manipulate the environment around you. As players draw mana or cast spells, a Rogue Event may be triggered by the Tower, which is known for its chaotic tendencies. Fate (i.e., dice) then decides whether a boon is given the mages, spikes fly out of the wall, or a barrel of fish randomly appears (for example). Once the players turn is done, then the enemies have their turn. They target the mages with unending ambition, though they may have weaknesses that the mages can exploit.

In Rogue Mana, each floor has its own unique layout, enemies, and challenges. Beyond just surviving, the mages can try to collect 3 additional accolades (up to 4 total); two by collecting specific treasures, and one for collecting a magical orb. The more accolades collected upon completing the level, the more talented and powerful wizards they will become once they defeat the tower.

The campaign/game ends once the mages defeat the final level in the tower.

—description from the publisher

Name: Der Hochtourist
Description:
Each player pays 5 coins in the till and take turns to roll and move. Only one die is used. If a player rolls 6 eyes, de don't move any further, but pays a penalty because he is too eager. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Only the one who throws 1 and thus comes to space 1 can start the journey.
The first to the summit of the Zugspitze gets half the contents of the till. Those who have reached the summit can start their way back without any obstacles. Only those who get to 5 are eliminated from the game due to fatigue. Whoever gets over space 1 first gets all the rest of the till.
